values.description:
Fix topic echo test and make msgs visible.

Note that the widget still crashes on destruction if messages have been received. 

I'm not sure why removing the buffer property solved the test failure, but it may be related to why destruction is still failing when there have been messages.

More info:

* Crash happens on `QQmlPropertyCache` destructor:

~~~
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(0x7fbcacc3acd7) [0x7fbcacc3acd7]                                                                                        
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD1Ev+0x6e) [0x7fbcace30fce]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace31419]                                                                                       
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN12QQmlMetaType24freeUnusedTypesAndCachesEv+0x345) [0x7fbcace01745]                                                                  
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlEnginePrivateD1Ev+0xb2) [0x7fbcacdd6272]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN28QQmlApplicationEnginePrivateD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace68649]                                                            
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN7QObjectD1Ev+0x643) [0x7fbcabc1da13]                                                                               
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN10QQmlEngineD1Ev+0x110) [0x7fbcacdda980]
~~~

* I tried using the pointer version of [QQmlContext::setContextProperty](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qqmlcontext.html#setContextProperty) as opposed to the reference version, because it says that it won't take ownership, but the crash still happens. Since it looks like the issue is related to a cache, maybe Qt is doing something else with the property, and I'm not sure how to prevent.

* I tried changing the remaining properties (`topic`, `paused`) like I did for `buffer` to fix the test, but the runtime crash still happens.

* There's no crash if the plugins are loaded in separate windows.
values.title: Topic echo fix

summary.raw:
Fix topic echo test and make msgs visible.

Note that the widget still crashes on destruction if messages have been received. 

I'm not sure why removing the buffer property solved the test failure, but it may be related to why destruction is still failing when there have been messages.

More info:

* Crash happens on `QQmlPropertyCache` destructor:

~~~
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(0x7fbcacc3acd7) [0x7fbcacc3acd7]                                                                                        
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD1Ev+0x6e) [0x7fbcace30fce]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace31419]                                                                                       
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN12QQmlMetaType24freeUnusedTypesAndCachesEv+0x345) [0x7fbcace01745]                                                                  
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlEnginePrivateD1Ev+0xb2) [0x7fbcacdd6272]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN28QQmlApplicationEnginePrivateD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace68649]                                                            
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN7QObjectD1Ev+0x643) [0x7fbcabc1da13]                                                                               
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN10QQmlEngineD1Ev+0x110) [0x7fbcacdda980]
~~~

* I tried using the pointer version of [QQmlContext::setContextProperty](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qqmlcontext.html#setContextProperty) as opposed to the reference version, because it says that it won't take ownership, but the crash still happens. Since it looks like the issue is related to a cache, maybe Qt is doing something else with the property, and I'm not sure how to prevent.

* I tried changing the remaining properties (`topic`, `paused`) like I did for `buffer` to fix the test, but the runtime crash still happens.

* There's no crash if the plugins are loaded in separate windows.
summary.html:
Fix topic echo test and make msgs visible.

Note that the widget still crashes on destruction if messages have been received.

I'm not sure why removing the buffer property solved the test failure, but it may be related to why destruction is still failing when there have been messages.

More info:

  • Crash happens on QQmlPropertyCache destructor:
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(0x7fbcacc3acd7) [0x7fbcacc3acd7]                                                                                        
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD1Ev+0x6e) [0x7fbcace30fce]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace31419]                                                                                       
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN12QQmlMetaType24freeUnusedTypesAndCachesEv+0x345) [0x7fbcace01745]                                                                  
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlEnginePrivateD1Ev+0xb2) [0x7fbcacdd6272]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN28QQmlApplicationEnginePrivateD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace68649]                                                            
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN7QObjectD1Ev+0x643) [0x7fbcabc1da13]                                                                               
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN10QQmlEngineD1Ev+0x110) [0x7fbcacdda980]

  • I tried using the pointer version of QQmlContext::setContextProperty as opposed to the reference version, because it says that it won't take ownership, but the crash still happens. Since it looks like the issue is related to a cache, maybe Qt is doing something else with the property, and I'm not sure how to prevent.

  • I tried changing the remaining properties (topic, paused) like I did for buffer to fix the test, but the runtime crash still happens.

  • There's no crash if the plugins are loaded in separate windows.

values.description:
This PR allows decoupling toolbar colors from material theme colors, providing more flexible customization.

Check the tutorial for more details.

---

Try out the example config:

    ign gui -v 4 -c examples/config/style_toolbars.config

Light theme:

![light_toolbar.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/334588351-light_toolbar.png)

* Top toolbar uses custom green colors
* Plugin toolbars use custom blue colors
* The rest of the UI follows the material primary (i.e. teal fabs) and material secondary (i.e. selected text field) colors

Dark theme:

![dark_toolbar.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2805393501-dark_toolbar.png)

* Again, toolbars follow the colors provided in the config for that theme
* Primary and secondary colors adapt automatically
values.title: [Blueprint] Toolbar colors

This PR allows decoupling toolbar colors from material theme colors, providing more flexible customization.

Check the tutorial for more details.

---

    ign gui -v 4 -c examples/config/style_toolbars.config

Dark theme:

* Primary and secondary colors adapt automatically
summary.html:
This PR allows decoupling toolbar colors from material theme colors, providing more flexible customization.

Check the tutorial for more details.

Try out the example config:

ign gui -v 4 -c examples/config/style_toolbars.config

Light theme:

  • Top toolbar uses custom green colors
  • Plugin toolbars use custom blue colors
  • The rest of the UI follows the material primary (i.e. teal fabs) and material secondary (i.e. selected text field) colors

Dark theme:

  • Again, toolbars follow the colors provided in the config for that theme
  • Primary and secondary colors adapt automatically

values.description: Clicking on a button in any ign-gui plugin causes ign-gui to crash on exit.  Not exactly sure if this is the right solution but changing the way the qml application engine is deleted solves the problem for me. Fixes the crash discovered [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/316/blueprint-add-support-for-moving-and/activity#comment-101676785)
values.title: Delete QmlApplicationEngine later

summary.raw: Clicking on a button in any ign-gui plugin causes ign-gui to crash on exit.  Not exactly sure if this is the right solution but changing the way the qml application engine is deleted solves the problem for me. Fixes the crash discovered [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/316/blueprint-add-support-for-moving-and/activity#comment-101676785)
summary.html: Clicking on a button in any ign-gui plugin causes ign-gui to crash on exit. Not exactly sure if this is the right solution but changing the way the qml application engine is deleted solves the problem for me. Fixes the crash discovered here

values.description:
TRI needs updates that exist in ign-rendering2, but they can't upgrade ign-gui at this time. So, we are proposing to bump the dependencies on ign-gui0.

I think this is okay since TRI is the only known user of ign-gui0, no other released downstream ignition package uses ign-gui0.

I had to bump the math version because ign-rendering uses math6 and we can't link against both math5 and math6.

Requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/138/use-math6/diff
values.title: Gui0 use rendering2

summary.raw:
TRI needs updates that exist in ign-rendering2, but they can't upgrade ign-gui at this time. So, we are proposing to bump the dependencies on ign-gui0.

I think this is okay since TRI is the only known user of ign-gui0, no other released downstream ignition package uses ign-gui0.

I had to bump the math version because ign-rendering uses math6 and we can't link against both math5 and math6.

Requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/138/use-math6/diff
summary.html:
TRI needs updates that exist in ign-rendering2, but they can't upgrade ign-gui at this time. So, we are proposing to bump the dependencies on ign-gui0.

I think this is okay since TRI is the only known user of ign-gui0, no other released downstream ignition package uses ign-gui0.

I had to bump the math version because ign-rendering uses math6 and we can't link against both math5 and math6.

Requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/138/use-math6/diff

values.description:
* Bump ignition-common2 to ignition-common3
* Lambdas were retaining in memory plugins once they were removed, so we make sure to use a weak pointer instead.
* Closing\(\) signal is connected to a method that removes the caller along with its parent. So there’s no need to set the parent to null
* When we load a new configuration, we need to clean every plugin along with the docks.
values.title: Bump ign-common version and use weak pointers in lambdas

summary.raw:
* Bump ignition-common2 to ignition-common3
* Lambdas were retaining in memory plugins once they were removed, so we make sure to use a weak pointer instead.
* Closing\(\) signal is connected to a method that removes the caller along with its parent. So there’s no need to set the parent to null
* When we load a new configuration, we need to clean every plugin along with the docks.
summary.html:
• Bump ignition-common2 to ignition-common3
  • Lambdas were retaining in memory plugins once they were removed, so we make sure to use a weak pointer instead.
  • Closing() signal is connected to a method that removes the caller along with its parent. So there’s no need to set the parent to null
  • When we load a new configuration, we need to clean every plugin along with the docks.

values.description:
Some new features will be landing on `ign-rendering3` soon, and if we want to use them on `ign-gazebo3`, we need to update the whole dependency chain not to depend on `ign-rendering2`.

Repos affected: `ign-sensors`, `ign-gui`, `ign-gazebo`
values.title: Depend on ign-rendering3

summary.raw:
Some new features will be landing on `ign-rendering3` soon, and if we want to use them on `ign-gazebo3`, we need to update the whole dependency chain not to depend on `ign-rendering2`.

Repos affected: `ign-sensors`, `ign-gui`, `ign-gazebo`
summary.html:
Some new features will be landing on ign-rendering3 soon, and if we want to use them on ign-gazebo3, we need to update the whole dependency chain not to depend on ign-rendering2.

Repos affected: ign-sensors, ign-gui, ign-gazebo

values.description:
Icon used by the windowing system.

Downstream applications can override this using [MainWindow::setIcon](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qwindow.html#setIcon) once they get the window.

![Screenshot from 2019-08-05 17-58-31.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/754996786-Screenshot_from_2019-08-05_17-58-31.png)

I'll tackle changing that `Unknown` string on the top another day.

values.description:
Fixed issue with ImageDisplay showing incorrect image stream.

Found this older doc from QtQuick Controls 1 that says `currentText` is not guaranteed to be up-to-date when the combo box’s index changed:

[https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-qtquick-controls-combobox.html#currentText-prop](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-qtquick-controls-combobox.html#currentText-prop)
values.title: Fix changing topics in ImageDisplay

summary.raw:
Fixed issue with ImageDisplay showing incorrect image stream.

Found this older doc from QtQuick Controls 1 that says `currentText` is not guaranteed to be up-to-date when the combo box’s index changed:

[https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-qtquick-controls-combobox.html#currentText-prop](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-qtquick-controls-combobox.html#currentText-prop)
summary.html:
Fixed issue with ImageDisplay showing incorrect image stream.

Found this older doc from QtQuick Controls 1 that says currentText is not guaranteed to be up-to-date when the combo box’s index changed:

https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-qtquick-controls-combobox.html#currentText-prop

values.description:
Insert spaces into `CamelCased` plugin names. Plugin names that include `_` / `-` are not because this function needs to be reversible right now (i.e. remove spaces).

In the future, it would be good for the `PluginListModel` to return something more complex than `QStringList`, so more data can be put into each item. For example: file name, human-readable name,  version, etc.

Before | After
-- | --
![before_pretty_gui.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/1680222298-before_pretty_gui.png) | ![pretty_gui_plugin.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4105763078-pretty_gui_plugin.png)
values.title: Prettify plugin menu

summary.raw:
Insert spaces into `CamelCased` plugin names. Plugin names that include `_` / `-` are not because this function needs to be reversible right now (i.e. remove spaces).

In the future, it would be good for the `PluginListModel` to return something more complex than `QStringList`, so more data can be put into each item. For example: file name, human-readable name,  version, etc.

Before | After
-- | --
![before_pretty_gui.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/1680222298-before_pretty_gui.png) | ![pretty_gui_plugin.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4105763078-pretty_gui_plugin.png)
summary.html:
Insert spaces into CamelCased plugin names. Plugin names that include _ / - are not because this function needs to be reversible right now (i.e. remove spaces).

In the future, it would be good for the PluginListModel to return something more complex than QStringList, so more data can be put into each item. For example: file name, human-readable name, version, etc.

Before After

values.description: As explained [here](https://leethomason.github.io/tinyxml2/classtinyxml2_1_1_x_m_l_element.html#a6d5c8d115561ade4e4456b71d91b6f51), `elem->GetText()` will return null if the element has nested elements. So this PR makes sure we don't crash if users try to use invalid configs.
values.title: Protect against null tinyxml GetText

summary.raw: As explained [here](https://leethomason.github.io/tinyxml2/classtinyxml2_1_1_x_m_l_element.html#a6d5c8d115561ade4e4456b71d91b6f51), `elem->GetText()` will return null if the element has nested elements. So this PR makes sure we don't crash if users try to use invalid configs.
summary.html: As explained here, elem->GetText() will return null if the element has nested elements. So this PR makes sure we don't crash if users try to use invalid configs.

values.description:
QML contexts are helpful to share C++ data with the QML file.

So far, we've been using the application's root context for that, for example:

```
  ignition::gui::App()->Engine()->rootContext()->setContextProperty(
      "CustomData", &this->dataPtr->customData);
```

However, this becomes a problem if we want to have different `customData`s working side-by-side.

With this pull request, plugins can set properties within their own context and avoid polluting the root context:

```
  this->Context()->setContextProperty(
      "CustomData", &this->dataPtr->customData);
```

This is especially handy if users need to instantiate the same plugin more than once. I ran into this need while working on [inspectors](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/528/wip-component-inspector/diff).

As far as I could tell, there's no way to get the original `QQmlContext` from the plugin item, so I needed to expose it here.
values.title: Expose QML context to plugins

summary.raw:
QML contexts are helpful to share C++ data with the QML file.

So far, we've been using the application's root context for that, for example:

```
  ignition::gui::App()->Engine()->rootContext()->setContextProperty(
      "CustomData", &this->dataPtr->customData);
```

However, this becomes a problem if we want to have different `customData`s working side-by-side.

With this pull request, plugins can set properties within their own context and avoid polluting the root context:

```
  this->Context()->setContextProperty(
      "CustomData", &this->dataPtr->customData);
```

This is especially handy if users need to instantiate the same plugin more than once. I ran into this need while working on [inspectors](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/528/wip-component-inspector/diff).

As far as I could tell, there's no way to get the original `QQmlContext` from the plugin item, so I needed to expose it here.
summary.html:
QML contexts are helpful to share C++ data with the QML file.

So far, we've been using the application's root context for that, for example:

  ignition::gui::App()->Engine()->rootContext()->setContextProperty(
      "CustomData", &this->dataPtr->customData);

However, this becomes a problem if we want to have different customDatas working side-by-side.

With this pull request, plugins can set properties within their own context and avoid polluting the root context:

  this->Context()->setContextProperty(
      "CustomData", &this->dataPtr->customData);

This is especially handy if users need to instantiate the same plugin more than once. I ran into this need while working on inspectors.

As far as I could tell, there's no way to get the original QQmlContext from the plugin item, so I needed to expose it here.

values.description: While porting `ign-gui0` to use QtQuick into `ign-gui1`, some plugins were kept in the `.vo_unported` folder for convenience. Now that we already have `ign-gui3`, the files on that folder, as well as some left-overs outside it, cause more confusion than help. We can always go back to the `ign-gui0` branch to see how something used to be implemented, so I propose we just delete all these files.
values.title: Remove old ign-gui0 stuff

summary.raw: While porting `ign-gui0` to use QtQuick into `ign-gui1`, some plugins were kept in the `.vo_unported` folder for convenience. Now that we already have `ign-gui3`, the files on that folder, as well as some left-overs outside it, cause more confusion than help. We can always go back to the `ign-gui0` branch to see how something used to be implemented, so I propose we just delete all these files.
summary.html: While porting ign-gui0 to use QtQuick into ign-gui1, some plugins were kept in the .vo_unported folder for convenience. Now that we already have ign-gui3, the files on that folder, as well as some left-overs outside it, cause more confusion than help. We can always go back to the ign-gui0 branch to see how something used to be implemented, so I propose we just delete all these files.

values.description:
Fix these warnings: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-ign-gui2-homebrew-amd64/15/warnings10Result/

The `pixel_format` ones are ignored the same way as [this PR](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-ign-gui2-homebrew-amd64/15/warnings10Result/).

And the Qt one just uses the new suggested API.
values.title: 👩‍🌾 Fix homebrew warnings

And the Qt one just uses the new suggested API.
summary.html:
Fix these warnings: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gui-ci-ign-gui2-homebrew-amd64/15/warnings10Result/

And the Qt one just uses the new suggested API.
